programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 8/8 Sheridan Smith presents the final of the contestant, which sees the three remaining contestants aiming to become top dog-groomer - and win themselves the Golden Stanley trophy to prove it. All they have to do is execute one of the toughest challenges in the industry - a continental clip on an elegant standard poodle. As if that were not enough, they have to guess a breed of dog while blindfolded, before one last dogwalk parade. Who will impress judges Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor the most? (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Sign Language) (Audio Described) Rating: 2.4

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: Further Back in Time for Dinner Season 5 Episode 4/6 The family discover a surprising decade of progress and optimism as they journey through the 1930s, with their larder now stuffed with familiar brands and snacks. Brandon and Rochelle take a trip out for dinner in their very first family car and there is popcorn to go with their own home cinema, but the family's old servant Debbie finds out that the 1930s bring hard times for working women such as her. However, as 1939 comes around the family's hopes for the future are dashed as their final party is interrupted by an historic radio announcement (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 2

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: Further Back in Time for Dinner Season 5 Episode 5/6 The Robshaws enter the 1940s and experience a decade dominated by war and entirely fuelled by rations, including powdered egg, nettles on toast and imitation brawn. They are even one family member down as Fred is evacuated to the countryside, but the war brings them together too as they share a Woolton pie in their very own Anderson shelter, the girls go dancing with Debbie and some GIs, and they all start to recognise how the family meal to bring them together in the good and bad times (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 2

programme.title: Best House in Town
programme.desc: York: Wildcard Season 1 Episode 4/20 Three wildcard properties are thrown into the mix in York - an eco-friendly futuristic dream home, a converted barn with a modern twist and a five-storey Georgian townhouse (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 5.6

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Ants Season 1 Episode 4/12 Chris Packham explores the ingenious ways in which ants have collaborated to colonise the planet like no other animal. Natural air conditioning systems keep them cool in their nests, shelters made from their own bodies protect them from the elements, and a strong sense of smell helps them to overpower animals hundreds of times larger than themselves. Plus, a look at recent research that reveals how ant colonies are capable of immunising themselves against certain diseases (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 5.4

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Crowcombe 45 Season 15 Episode 43/60 Paul Martin presents the show from Crowcombe Court, west Somerset, where experts James Lewis and Thomas Plant discover some promotional Victorian sausage plates (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 6.6

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Season 4 Episode 99/100 Mina Anwar, Glen Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson test their general knowledge skills on their penultimate day of head-scratchers (Subtitles) Rating: 8.7

programme.title: My Unique B&B

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Northern Exposure
programme.desc: Russia Season 1 Episode 3/6 As the travellers head for Russia, they swap vehicles for Dave's old motorbike and sidecar before spending a night backstage at the ballet, courtesy of one of Russia's most powerful oligarchs. Si and Dave also take a walking history lesson courtesy of St Petersburg's biggest fashion designers, and taste some of the country's finest foods (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.9

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 6/6 Mandy and Chris adore their Victorian home in Manchester, but they cannot unlock the potential of their garden. Overlooked on all sides, the couple feel exposed whenever they spend time in it. Providing inspiration for the area are designers Helen Elks-Smith and Pip Probert. Meanwhile, Joel Bird meets Ben and Elaine, a Wiltshire couple who have an unusual outdoor space. Angela Scanlon hosts (New Series) (Subtitles) Rating: 3

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Shangri-La, London Season 3 Episode 6/6 Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at London's Shangri-La Hotel, Britain's highest hostelry. Their expectations of a standard business guest experience are blown away by discovering a hotel that makes guests' personal moments special. From bath butlers to marriage proposals, the place is a resort for celebrations in the clouds (New Series) (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 2.4

programme.title: Funny Festival Live
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 5/5 Nabil Abdulrashid is at the helm with three comics on stage at a Covid-safe Comedy Club. Tim Renkow presents the rough guide to wheelchair use on public transport. Catherine Bohart dissects the pan sexual scale. Zoe Lyons has acquired some new skills, and Nabil rounds things off with an insight into what it is to be a 'practicing' black man. Filmed at the Bedford pub in Balham, South London (New Series) (Subtitles) Rating: 1.5

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie (2014)
programme.desc: The indomitable Irish matriarch discovers that a plan is afoot by developers to buy the famous Dublin street market where her family has run a fruit and veg stall for generations. Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney (Subtitles) (Audio Described) Rating: 2.5

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 8/8 Claudia Winkleman hosts as the remaining three contestants take part in the final as they compete to be crowned the first-ever winner of the competition, with the cooks having to impress Mary Berry, Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin if they're to win the title. First, the competitors take on the Rustle Up challenge, creating dishes that showcase butternut squash as the main ingredient, before being asked to produce their ultimate picnic and presenting their creations to the judges at a beautifully decorated picnic tables. Who will be crowned the winner? (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Sign Language) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.4

programme.title: Being Bridget Jones
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating 25 years of Helen Fielding's hapless creation. The programme examines the ways in which society's attitudes to women have shifted in 25 years, along with the ways in which female writers have told their own stories since Bridget made her debut. Featuring interviews with Helen Fielding, and the friends she based the original characters on, as well as tributes from celebrity fans (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Sign Language) (Audio Described) Rating: 3.1
